H0.text: Invertebrates constitute the majority of animals and are characterized by lacking a backbone.

H1.text: Vertebrate is the majority of animals belonging to the category characterized by the lack of a backbone.

H2.text: Nematode is the category that comprises the majority of animals, characterized by the lack of a backbone.

H3.text: Arthropods are the majority of animals and are characterized by lacking a backbone.

A4.text: Vertebrates are distinguished from all other animals, including other chordates, by multiple synapomorphies: namely a vertebral column; a skull of bone or cartilage;
